meanings.definition: Relating to or dependent on charity.
meanings.sent1: The eleemosynary organization provided free meals to the homeless.
meanings.sent2: Her eleemosynary actions towards the less fortunate warmed everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent3: The eleemosynary fundraiser was a success, raising enough money to help many in need.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as eleemosynary as her generous spirit, spreading joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The eleemosynary nature of the community shone brightly during times of crisis.

meanings.definition: Given as an act of charity.
meanings.sent1: The eleemosynary gifts brought smiles to the faces of the children in the orphanage.
meanings.sent2: She received an eleemosynary donation that helped her start her own business.
meanings.sent3: The eleemosynary gesture of sharing her lunch with a classmate made them fast friends.
meanings.sent4: His eleemosynary spirit was evident in the way he always put others' needs before his own.
meanings.sent5: The eleemosynary act of kindness created a ripple effect of goodwill in the community.

meanings.sent1: The eleemosynary foundation was able to continue its work thanks to generous donors.
meanings.sent2: The eleemosynary event raised funds to support local schools in need.
meanings.sent3: The eleemosynary project flourished with the help of kind-hearted contributors.
meanings.sent4: Her eleemosynary efforts were recognized and appreciated by those who believed in her cause.
meanings.sent5: The eleemosynary initiative thrived due to the unwavering support of the community.
